title: (x) 'Mountain Equipment Co-op' logo - Gotham {Bart Hakvoort}
content:
Can anyone help with the identification of the font used here?

This is the logo for Canada’s largest outdoor gear store, Mountain Equipment Co-op or MEC. As far as I know, the logo was designed in 1974 by Steven Brown, a designer from the US.

Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045758im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mec_logo_v1_m56577569830592813_5180.gif)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [mec\_logo\_v1\_m56577569830592813.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045758/http:/typophile.com/files/mec_logo_v1_m56577569830592813.gif) | 3.34 KB |

 [‹ (x) Eurostile/Foundry Monoline-like squarish sans "super x" - House Gothic 23 {Chris Keegan}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045758/http:/typophile.com/node/28666 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Lancôme Paris thin script - custom font by Christophe Badani {Yves, Emmanuel Leroy} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045758/http:/typophile.com/node/28663 "Go to next forum topic")
author: zalmoxe

comments.content:
This is actually MEC’s new logo ca. 2004. I believe the old one used Helvetica.

- Lex

Looks like you are right, **barthak** , thank you very much. :)

**Lex** , are you sure about that? If yes, do you know where I could find a copy of the old logo?

This is an excerpt from the MEC Annual General Meeting of 2006 which is where I based my information from, but it is pretty vague, and it could be mistaken:

“Steven Brown was the gentleman who developed the logo that has been in use since the time that he developed it. I think it was about 1974, and I just wanted to acknowledge him.”

[http://images.mec.ca/media/Images/pdf/MEC\_2006\_AGM\_Transcript\_v1\_m565775...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045758/http:/images.mec.ca/media/Images/pdf/MEC_2006_AGM_Transcript_v1_m56577569830602539.pdf "http://images.mec.ca/media/Images/pdf/MEC\_2006\_AGM\_Transcript\_v1\_m56577569830602539.pdf")
